explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: The flash point is 126degC (open cup flash test) (ICSC (1999))

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Not pyrophoric when in contact with air at ordinary temperatures: the auto-ignition temperature is 350degC (ICSC, 1999)

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not fluorine and chlorine), with the oxygen bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Cannot be classified due to lack of data, though the substance acts on steel, stainless steel and aluminum according to ICSC (1999). Classified into "Corrosive Substances" by the UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods. However, the category includes skin corrosivity, and it is unclear whether the substance is classified as "metal" corrosive (UN#1940).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the rat LD50 (oral route) value of 73mg/kg representing the lower of the two testing data, 73mg/kg and 261mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 2001-10 (2001)).

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Based on the rabbit LD50 (dermal route) value of 848mg/kg (CERI Hazard Data 2001-10 (2002)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Based on the testing data of rat LC50 (4 hour-inhalation of vapour) value of 56.7ppm was lower than 90% of the saturated vapour concentration (115ppm) under a saturated vapour pressure of 11.6Pa (25degC), the substance was considered as "vapour containing substantially no mist" and was classified based on standard values of gas.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on guinea pig skin irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 2001-10 (2002)): "severely irritating." Although it is unclear whether the effects are reversible or not, the substance is classified into Category 1A-1C, given the pH value of a 10% aqueous solution is 1.6. It should be placed in Category 1A from the viewpoint of safety if further classification is needed.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests (CERI Hazard Data 2001-10 (2002)): "The pH value of a 10% aqueous solution is 1.6." The substance is thus considered "corrosive."

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory Sensitizer: Classification not possible Skin Sensitizer: Category 1
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory sensitizer: No data available Skin sensitizer: Based on human epidemiological evidence of skin sensitization (CERI Hazard Data 2001-10 (2002)).

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on in vivo mutagenicity/genotoxicity tests and negative data on mutagenicity tests in vitro (reverse mutation tests and chromosome aberration tests), described in NTP DB (Access on Mar., 2006), CERI Hazard Data 2001-10 (2002) and IUCLID (2000).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification: Category 1 (respiratory organs, cardiovascular, central nervous system, liver)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the human evidence: "percutaneous absorption induced tachycardia, shallow respiration and oliguresis; deaths from cardiovascular collapse have also been reported" (CERI Hazard Data 2001-10 (2002)), and the evidence from animal studies including "tremor and spasm", "effects on the liver and irritation of the gastrointestinal tract were found at necropsy" (CERI Hazard Data 2001-10 (2002)) and "dyspnea" (RTECS (2004)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Categories 1 and 2.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 3 from 96 hours LC50=30mg/L of the fish (Fathead Minnows) (CERI Hazard Data, 2002).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Since there was rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 100% (Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)) and the bio-accumulation was low (log Kow=0.09 (PHYSPROP Database, 2005)), it was claasified into Not classified.
